content:
#23196 should be easy to review - it provides links in the function and module docstrings for docs#Nat.choose and for the module docstring in docs#Nat.factorial to point the user to the proofs that these count the objects they count.

For docs#Nat.choose, I believe this is especially important, since the function docstring claims that the counting definition is actually the definition, when in fact the real definition is the recursive one, and the proof that it counts something is in a completely different file.

(I've just spoken with a new user who was quite surprised that these statements were so well-hidden in mathlib.)
